abstract: The parent of Airbus posted a loss of 446 million euros, or $684 million, for 2007 but insisted that it has put the worst behind it.
snippet: The parent of Airbus posted a loss of 446 million euros, or $684 million, for 2007 but insisted that it has put the worst behind it.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  The European Aeronautic Defense and Space Company, the parent of the plane maker Airbus, posted its first annual loss in five years on Tuesday, but said its prospects had improved after the Air Force awarded it and an American partner a $35 billion contract to build a fleet of refueling planes.

headline.main: Parent of Airbus Posts First Annual Loss in 5 Years
headline.print_headline: Parent of Airbus Posts First Annual Loss in 5 Years

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co

abstract: In its challenge to the Air Force’s award of a $35 billion contract to its rival, Boeing said the military had changed specifications to accommodate the bigger Airbus plane.
snippet: In its challenge to the Air Force’s award of a $35 billion contract to its rival, Boeing said the military had changed specifications to accommodate the bigger Airbus plane.
lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Boeing filed a formal protest on Tuesday seeking to overturn the Air Force’s award of a $35 billion contract to build aerial-refueling planes to a team that includes its European rival, Airbus. It said that the military had changed specifications to accommodate the bigger Airbus plane.

headline.main: Boeing, in Contract Protest, Cites Changes to Air Tanker
headline.print_headline: Boeing, in Contract Protest, Cites Changes to Air Tanker

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co

abstract: The airline said it had grounded the planes after questions arose as to whether required testing had been done.
snippet: The airline said it had grounded the planes after questions arose as to whether required testing had been done.
lead_paragraph: Southwest Airlines said Wednesday that it had grounded 38 of its Boeing 737s after a review of maintenance records Tuesday night led it to question whether required testing had been done. The airline said the groundings forced it to cancel 4 percent of its flights on Wednesday.
